oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry Network Broadcast - 1955-06-18
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This recording is of the Grand Ole Opry radio show on June 18, 1955. This tape features performers: Bill Carlisles and the Carlisles, Hank Snow, the Old Hickory Singers, Rod Brasfield, Grandpa Jones, Anita Kerr Singers, and host, Grant Turner. The last four minutes is the ending of the Hank Snow Story by Mae Axton. Tape is the sixth of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bill Carlisle; Hank Snow; Old Hickory Singers; Grant Turner; Carlisles; Rod Brasfield; Grandpa Jones; Anita Kerr Singers;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) A mix of sounds from other recordings -- (00:21) Commercial for BC, headache relief -- (00:28) Audio cuts out -- (00:45) Grand Ole Opry program begins -- (00:56) Would You Mind (Hank Snow) -- (02:38) Hank Snow and host, Grant Turner welcomes everyone to the Grand Ole Opry and previews line up for the show -- (03:16) Come Home Bill Bailey (The Old Hickory Singers) -- (04:57) Commercial for Prince Albert (P.A.) tobacco with Hank Snow and Grant Turner -- (06:02) Hank announces the Carlisles and talks to Bill Carlisle -- (06:30) Grant Turner and Bill Carlisle gives Hank Snow two awards for the "Artist with the Best Song for the Past Year" and the "Artist with the Best Vocal Record for the Past Year: I Don't Hurt Anymore" -- (07:03) Hank Snow thanks the disc jockeys and Country and Western Jamboree Magazine -- (07:24) Hank Snow awards The Carlisles for the "Best Singing Group in the Field of Country Music" from the Country and Western Jamboree Magazine -- (07:38) Bill Carlisle thank
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Snow, Hank; Carlisles (Musical group); Carlisle, Bill; Old Hickory Singers; Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Brasfield, Rod, 1910-1958; Grandpa Jones; Anita Kerr Singers; Grand Ole Opry (Radio program);
